Class Strings

extends Object
    Static utilities for strings

    • Method Detail

      • buildMessage

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull String buildMessage(@Nullable
                                                     @Nullable String message)
        This method is made to save resources from buildMessage(String, HashMap), buildMessage(String, Object...) and buildMessage(String, MapBuilder) to not go in a loop. In case that the message is null it will just give an string with the characters "Null"
        Parameters:
        message - the message to build
        Returns:
        "Null" if the message is null else the message

      • buildMessage

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull String buildMessage(@Nullable
                                                     @Nullable String message,
                                                     Object... strings)
        Build a message which has place holders in the next fashion:

        "This message has a {0}"

        "{0}" is the placeholder. It has to start from 0 and then scale up. The 0 represents the index from the objects array. The placeholder will be replaced with the Object.toString()

        Parameters:
        message - the message to build
        strings - the object that will replace the placeholders
        Returns:
        the built message

      • fromArray

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull String fromArray(@NotNull
                                                  @NotNull String[] strings)
        Builds a String from an array of strings. This method will make a loop for each string appending them in a string builder which will append a " " to the end of each string
        Parameters:
        strings - the string array to build the message
        Returns:
        a brand new string made with the array

      • buildMessage

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull String buildMessage(@Nullable
                                                     @Nullable String message,
                                                     @NotNull
                                                     @NotNull HashMap<String,String> placeHolders)
        Build a message using more readable placeholders. Instead of using a method such as buildMessage(String, Object...) this uses a map with the placeholder and the given object to replace it:

        "This message has a %placeholder%"

        "%placeholder%" is the placeholder that will be replaced with the object that it was given.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to build
        placeHolders - the placeholders and its values. The placeholders are the key and those do not require to have the character "%" and the value is another string
        Returns:
        the built message

      • buildMessage

        public static String buildMessage(@Nullable
                                  @Nullable String message,
                                  @NotNull
                                  @NotNull MapBuilder<String,String> placeholders)
        This method is the same as buildMessage(String, HashMap) but using the MapBuilder to give an option of easier to make map
        Parameters:
        message - the message to build
        placeholders - the placeholders and its values. The placeholders are the key and those do not require * to have the character "%" and the value is another string
        Returns:
        the built message

      • containsIgnoreCase

        public static boolean containsIgnoreCase(@NotNull
                                         @NotNull String string,
                                         @NotNull
                                         @NotNull String search)
        Missing method in String. Looks if a string contains a certain one ignoring casing
        Parameters:
        string - the string to look if is inside another string
        search - the another string to check if the string is inside of it
        Returns:
        true if its contained else false;

      • copyPartials

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull List<String> copyPartials(@NotNull
                                                           @NotNull String toMatch,
                                                           @NotNull
                                                           @NotNull List<String> list)
        Copies the strings that partially match in another array list of strings. This will check the strings inside the list that start with the string to match
        Parameters:
        list - the list to get the strings to partially match
        toMatch - the string to partially match
        Returns:
        the list with matching strings

      • getBuilder

        public static StringBuilder getBuilder()
        Get a clear instance of StringBuilder. Clear instance means that it does have a length of 0
        Returns:
        the clear instance of the string builder
